HumanPlayer

public HumanPlayer(java.lang.String name,
                   PatternScorer patternscoring,
                   boolean aided,
                   GUI gui)
contructor - requires the name of the player, and the size of the winning hand (for future proofing)

Parameters:
name - player name
patternscoring - the PatternScorer object this player will use for score analysis
aided - boolean indicating whether this player is aided by an AI
gui - the GUI that this player plays out of
Method Detail

checkBestChow

protected int[] checkBestChow(int tile)
if there is more than one chow to make with a claimed tile, this method is used to disambiguate between the possibilities, by scoring the pattern that results from making each, and selecting the chow that matches the highest scoring pattern

Overrides:
checkBestChow in class Player
Parameters:
tile - the tile with which to make a chow
Returns:
an int[] array of three tiles representing the chow that has been selected

lookingFor

public int lookingFor(int tile,
                      Player from)
               throws UndoException,
                      IllegalOutException
The human player has no auto-support, he or she will have to determine the claimtype all on their own

Overrides:
lookingFor in class Player
Parameters:
tile - the currently available tile
Returns:
the integer representation of which set this player can use the available tile for
Throws:
UndoException

process

public int process(int wallsize,
                   int prevplayer)
            throws PlayerWonException,
                   UndoException
The human player has no auto-support, he or she has to determine which tile to discard on their own

Overrides:
process in class Player
Parameters:
wallsize - the size of the available wall
prevplayer - the previous player, important for chow likelihood estimation

protected boolean wantToKong(int tile)
Determines whether we want to use a concealed pung for a concealed kong, or whether we'll pass up on it.
